line_text: The scourge of greatness to be used on it;

line_text: And that same greatness too which our own hands
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Have holp to make so portly.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: My lord.--
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Worcester, get thee gone; for I do see
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Danger and disobedience in thine eye:

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: O, sir, your presence is too bold and peremptory,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And majesty might never yet endure
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: The moody frontier of a servant brow.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: You have good leave to leave us: when we need
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Your use and counsel, we shall send for you.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Yea, my good lord.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Those prisoners in your highness' name demanded,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Which Harry Percy here at Holmedon took,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: Were, as he says, not with such strength denied

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: As is deliver'd to your majesty:

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Is guilty of this fault and not my son.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: My liege, I did deny no prisoners.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: But I remember, when the fight was done,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: When I was dry with rage and extreme toil,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Breathless and faint, leaning upon my sword,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Came there a certain lord, neat, and trimly dress'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Fresh as a bridegroom; and his chin new reap'd
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Show'd like a stubble-land at harvest-home;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He was perfumed like a milliner;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And 'twixt his finger and his thumb he held
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: A pouncet-box, which ever and anon
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He gave his nose and took't away again;

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Who therewith angry, when it next came there,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Took it in snuff; and still he smiled and talk'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth

line_text: And as the soldiers bore dead bodies by,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He call'd them untaught knaves, unmannerly,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To bring a slovenly unhandsome corse
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Betwixt the wind and his nobility.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: With many holiday and lady terms
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He question'd me; amongst the rest, demanded
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: My prisoners in your majesty's behalf.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: I then, all smarting with my wounds being cold,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To be so pester'd with a popinjay,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Out of my grief and my impatience,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Answer'd neglectingly I know not what,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He should or he should not; for he made me mad
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To see him shine so brisk and smell so sweet
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And talk so like a waiting-gentlewoman
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Of guns and drums and wounds,--God save the mark!--
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And telling me the sovereign'st thing on earth
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Was parmaceti for an inward bruise;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And that it was great pity, so it was,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: This villanous salt-petre should be digg'd
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Out of the bowels of the harmless earth,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Which many a good tall fellow had destroy'd
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: So cowardly; and but for these vile guns,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He would himself have been a soldier.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: This bald unjointed chat of his, my lord,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: I answer'd indirectly, as I said;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And I beseech you, let not his report

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Come current for an accusation

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Betwixt my love and your high majesty.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: The circumstance consider'd, good my lord,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Whate'er Lord Harry Percy then had said
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To such a person and in such a place,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: At such a time, with all the rest retold,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: May reasonably die and never rise
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To do him wrong or any way impeach

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: What then he said, so he unsay it now.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Why, yet he doth deny his prisoners,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: But with proviso and exception,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: That we at our own charge shall ransom straight
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: His brother-in-law, the foolish Mortimer;

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Who, on my soul, hath wilfully betray'd
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: The lives of those that he did lead to fight

line_text: Against that great magician, damn'd Glendower,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Whose daughter, as we hear, the Earl of March
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Hath lately married. Shall our coffers, then,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Be emptied to redeem a traitor home?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Shall we but treason? and indent with fears,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: When they have lost and forfeited themselves?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: No, on the barren mountains let him starve;

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: For I shall never hold that man my friend

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Whose tongue shall ask me for one penny cost

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To ransom home revolted Mortimer.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Revolted Mortimer!

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He never did fall off, my sovereign liege,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: But by the chance of war; to prove that true
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Needs no more but one tongue for all those wounds,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Those mouthed wounds, which valiantly he took

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: When on the gentle Severn's sedgy bank,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: In single opposition, hand to hand,

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He did confound the best part of an hour

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: In changing hardiment with great Glendower:

line_text: they drink,

line_text: Upon agreement, of swift Severn's flood;

line_text: Ran fearfully among the trembling reeds,

line_text: Bloodstained with these valiant combatants.

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Never did base and rotten policy

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Colour her working with such deadly wounds;

play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Receive so many, and all willingly:

scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Thou dost belie him, Percy, thou dost belie him;

line_text: He never did encounter with Glendower:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: I tell thee,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He durst as well have met the devil alone
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: As Owen Glendower for an enemy.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Art thou not ashamed? But, sirrah, henceforth
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Let me not hear you speak of Mortimer:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Send me your prisoners with the speediest means,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Or you shall hear in such a kind from me
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: As will displease you. My Lord Northumberland,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: We licence your departure with your son.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Send us your prisoners, or you will hear of it.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: An if the devil come and roar for them,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: I will not send them: I will after straight
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And tell him so; for I will ease my heart,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Albeit I make a hazard of my head.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: What, drunk with choler? stay and pause awhile:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Here comes your uncle.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Speak of Mortimer!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: 'Zounds, I will speak of him; and let my soul
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Want mercy, if I do not join with him:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Yea, on his part I'll empty all these veins,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And shed my dear blood drop by drop in the dust,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: But I will lift the down-trod Mortimer
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: As high in the air as this unthankful king,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: As this ingrate and canker'd Bolingbroke.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Brother, the king hath made your nephew mad.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Who struck this heat up after I was gone?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He will, forsooth, have all my prisoners;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And when I urged the ransom once again
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Of my wife's brother, then his cheek look'd pale,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And on my face he turn'd an eye of death,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Trembling even at the name of Mortimer.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: I cannot blame him: was not he proclaim'd
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: By Richard that dead is the next of blood?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He was; I heard the proclamation:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And then it was when the unhappy king,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: --Whose wrongs in us God pardon!--did set forth
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Upon his Irish expedition;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: From whence he intercepted did return
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To be deposed and shortly murdered.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And for whose death we in the world's wide mouth
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Live scandalized and foully spoken of.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: But soft, I pray you; did King Richard then
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Proclaim my brother Edmund Mortimer
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Heir to the crown?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: He did; myself did hear it.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Nay, then I cannot blame his cousin king,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: That wished him on the barren mountains starve.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: But shall it be that you, that set the crown
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Upon the head of this forgetful man
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And for his sake wear the detested blot
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Of murderous subornation, shall it be,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: That you a world of curses undergo,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Being the agents, or base second means,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: The cords, the ladder, or the hangman rather?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: O, pardon me that I descend so low,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To show the line and the predicament
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Wherein you range under this subtle king;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Shall it for shame be spoken in these days,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Or fill up chronicles in time to come,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: That men of your nobility and power
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: Did gage them both in an unjust behalf,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: As both of you--God pardon it!--have done,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: To put down Richard, that sweet lovely rose,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: An plant this thorn, this canker, Bolingbroke?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: And shall it in more shame be further spoken,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

line_text: That you are fool'd, discarded and shook off
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: See how this river comes me cranking in,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And cuts me from the best of all my land
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: A huge half-moon, a monstrous cantle out.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I'll have the current in this place damm'd up;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And here the smug and silver Trent shall run
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: In a new channel, fair and evenly;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: It shall not wind with such a deep indent,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: To rob me of so rich a bottom here.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Not wind? it shall, it must; you see it doth.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Yea, but
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Mark how he bears his course, and runs me up
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: With like advantage on the other side;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Gelding the opposed continent as much
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: As on the other side it takes from you.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Yea, but a little charge will trench him here
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And on this north side win this cape of land;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And then he runs straight and even.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I'll have it so: a little charge will do it.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I'll not have it alter'd.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Will not you?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: No, nor you shall not.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Who shall say me nay?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Why, that will I.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Let me not understand you, then; speak it in Welsh.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I can speak English, lord, as well as you;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: For I was train'd up in the English court;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Where, being but young, I framed to the harp
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Many an English ditty lovely well
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And gave the tongue a helpful ornament,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: A virtue that was never seen in you.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Marry,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And I am glad of it with all my heart:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I had rather be a kitten and cry mew
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Than one of these same metre ballad-mongers;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I had rather hear a brazen canstick turn'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Or a dry wheel grate on the axle-tree;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And that would set my teeth nothing on edge,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Nothing so much as mincing poetry:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: 'Tis like the forced gait of a shuffling nag.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Come, you shall have Trent turn'd.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I do not care: I'll give thrice so much land
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: To any well-deserving friend;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: But in the way of bargain, mark ye me,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I'll cavil on the ninth part of a hair.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Are the indentures drawn? shall we be gone?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: The moon shines fair; you may away by night:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I'll haste the writer and withal
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Break with your wives of your departure hence:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I am afraid my daughter will run mad,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: So much she doteth on her Mortimer.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Fie, cousin Percy! how you cross my father!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I cannot choose: sometime he angers me
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: With telling me of the mouldwarp and the ant,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Of the dreamer Merlin and his prophecies,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And of a dragon and a finless fish,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: A clip-wing'd griffin and a moulten raven,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: A couching lion and a ramping cat,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And such a deal of skimble-skamble stuff
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: As puts me from my faith. I tell you what;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: He held me last night at least nine hours
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: In reckoning up the several devils' names
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: That were his lackeys: I cried 'hum,' and 'well, go to,'
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: But mark'd him not a word. O, he is as tedious
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: As a tired horse, a railing wife;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Worse than a smoky house: I had rather live
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: With cheese and garlic in a windmill, far,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Than feed on cates and have him talk to me
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: In any summer-house in Christendom.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: In faith, he is a worthy gentleman,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Exceedingly well read, and profited
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: In strange concealments, valiant as a lion
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And as wondrous affable and as bountiful
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: As mines of India. Shall I tell you, cousin?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: He holds your temper in a high respect
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And curbs himself even of his natural scope
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: When you come 'cross his humour; faith, he does:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I warrant you, that man is not alive
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Might so have tempted him as you have done,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Without the taste of danger and reproof:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: But do not use it oft, let me entreat you.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: In faith, my lord, you are too wilful-blame;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And since your coming hither have done enough
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: To put him quite beside his patience.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: You must needs learn, lord, to amend this fault:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Though sometimes it show greatness, courage, blood,--
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And that's the dearest grace it renders you,--
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Yet oftentimes it doth present harsh rage,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Defect of manners, want of government,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Pride, haughtiness, opinion and disdain:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: The least of which haunting a nobleman
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Loseth men's hearts and leaves behind a stain
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Upon the beauty of all parts besides,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Beguiling them of commendation.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Well, I am school'd: good manners be your speed!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Here come our wives, and let us take our leave.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: This is the deadly spite that angers me;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: My wife can speak no English, I no Welsh.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: My daughter weeps: she will not part with you;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: She'll be a soldier too, she'll to the wars.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Good father, tell her that she and my aunt Percy
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Shall follow in your conduct speedily.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: She is desperate here; a peevish self-wind harlotry,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: one that no persuasion can do good upon.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I understand thy looks: that pretty Welsh
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Which thou pour'st down from these swelling heavens
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I am too perfect in; and, but for shame,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: In such a parley should I answer thee.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I understand thy kisses and thou mine,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And that's a feeling disputation:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: But I will never be a truant, love,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Till I have learned thy language; for thy tongue
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Makes Welsh as sweet as ditties highly penn'd,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Sung by a fair queen in a summer's bower,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: With ravishing division, to her lute.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Nay, if you melt, then will she run mad.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: O, I am ignorance itself in this!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: She bids you on the wanton rushes lay you down
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And rest your gentle head upon her lap,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And she will sing the song that pleaseth you
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And on your eyelids crown the god of sleep.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Charming your blood with pleasing heaviness,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Making such difference 'twixt wake and sleep
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: As is the difference betwixt day and night
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: The hour before the heavenly-harness'd team
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Begins his golden progress in the east.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: With all my heart I'll sit and hear her sing:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: By that time will our book, I think, be drawn
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Do so;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And those musicians that shall play to you
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Hang in the air a thousand leagues from hence,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And straight they shall be here: sit, and attend.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Come, Kate, thou art perfect in lying down: come,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: quick, quick, that I may lay my head in thy lap.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Go, ye giddy goose.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Now I perceive the devil understands Welsh;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And 'tis no marvel he is so humorous.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: By'r lady, he is a good musician.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Then should you be nothing but musical for you are
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: altogether governed by humours. Lie still, ye thief,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: and hear the lady sing in Welsh.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I had rather hear Lady, my brach, howl in Irish.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Wouldst thou have thy head broken?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: No.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Then be still.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Neither;'tis a woman's fault.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Now God help thee!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: To the Welsh lady's bed.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: What's that?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Peace! she sings.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Come, Kate, I'll have your song too.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Not mine, in good sooth.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Not yours, in good sooth! Heart! you swear like a
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: comfit-maker's wife. 'Not you, in good sooth,' and
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: 'as true as I live,' and 'as God shall mend me,' and
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: 'as sure as day,'
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And givest such sarcenet surety for thy oaths,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: As if thou never walk'st further than Finsbury.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Swear me, Kate, like a lady as thou art,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: A good mouth-filling oath, and leave 'in sooth,'
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And such protest of pepper-gingerbread,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: To velvet-guards and Sunday-citizens.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Come, sing.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: I will not sing.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: 'Tis the next way to turn tailor, or be red-breast
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: teacher. An the indentures be drawn, I'll away
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: within these two hours; and so, come in when ye will.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Come, come, Lord Mortimer; you are as slow
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: As hot Lord Percy is on fire to go.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: By this our book is drawn; we'll but seal,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: And then to horse immediately.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: With all my heart.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.

line_text: Lords, give us leave; the Prince of Wales and I
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Must have some private conference; but be near at hand,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: For we shall presently have need of you.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: I know not whether God will have it so,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: For some displeasing service I have done,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: That, in his secret doom, out of my blood
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: He'll breed revengement and a scourge for me;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: But thou dost in thy passages of life
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Make me believe that thou art only mark'd
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: For the hot vengeance and the rod of heaven
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To punish my mistreadings. Tell me else,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Could such inordinate and low desires,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Such poor, such bare, such lewd, such mean attempts,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Such barren pleasures, rude society,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: As thou art match'd withal and grafted to,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Accompany the greatness of thy blood
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And hold their level with thy princely heart?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: So please your majesty, I would I could
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Quit all offences with as clear excuse
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: As well as I am doubtless I can purge
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Myself of many I am charged withal:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Yet such extenuation let me beg,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: As, in reproof of many tales devised,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: which oft the ear of greatness needs must hear,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: By smiling pick-thanks and base news-mongers,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: I may, for some things true, wherein my youth
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Hath faulty wander'd and irregular,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Find pardon on my true submission.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: God pardon thee! yet let me wonder, Harry,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: At thy affections, which do hold a wing
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Quite from the flight of all thy ancestors.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Thy place in council thou hast rudely lost.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Which by thy younger brother is supplied,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And art almost an alien to the hearts
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Of all the court and princes of my blood:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: The hope and expectation of thy time
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Is ruin'd, and the soul of every man
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Prophetically doth forethink thy fall.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Had I so lavish of my presence been,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: So common-hackney'd in the eyes of men,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: So stale and cheap to vulgar company,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Opinion, that did help me to the crown,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Had still kept loyal to possession
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And left me in reputeless banishment,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: A fellow of no mark nor likelihood.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: By being seldom seen, I could not stir
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: But like a comet I was wonder'd at;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: That men would tell their children 'This is he;'
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Others would say 'Where, which is Bolingbroke?'
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And then I stole all courtesy from heaven,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And dress'd myself in such humility
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: That I did pluck allegiance from men's hearts,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Loud shouts and salutations from their mouths,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Even in the presence of the crowned king.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Thus did I keep my person fresh and new;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: My presence, like a robe pontifical,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Ne'er seen but wonder'd at: and so my state,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Seldom but sumptuous, showed like a feast
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And won by rareness such solemnity.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: The skipping king, he ambled up and down
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: With shallow jesters and rash bavin wits,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Soon kindled and soon burnt; carded his state,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Mingled his royalty with capering fools,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Had his great name profaned with their scorns
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And gave his countenance, against his name,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To laugh at gibing boys and stand the push
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Of every beardless vain comparative,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Grew a companion to the common streets,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Enfeoff'd himself to popularity;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: That, being daily swallow'd by men's eyes,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: They surfeited with honey and began
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To loathe the taste of sweetness, whereof a little
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: More than a little is by much too much.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: So when he had occasion to be seen,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: He was but as the cuckoo is in June,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Heard, not regarded; seen, but with such eyes
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: As, sick and blunted with community,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Afford no extraordinary gaze,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Such as is bent on sun-like majesty
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: When it shines seldom in admiring eyes;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: But rather drowzed and hung their eyelids down,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Slept in his face and render'd such aspect
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: As cloudy men use to their adversaries,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Being with his presence glutted, gorged and full.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And in that very line, Harry, standest thou;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: For thou has lost thy princely privilege
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: With vile participation: not an eye
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: But is a-weary of thy common sight,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Save mine, which hath desired to see thee more;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Which now doth that I would not have it do,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Make blind itself with foolish tenderness.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: I shall hereafter, my thrice gracious lord,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Be more myself.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: For all the world
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: As thou art to this hour was Richard then
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: When I from France set foot at Ravenspurgh,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And even as I was then is Percy now.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Now, by my sceptre and my soul to boot,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: He hath more worthy interest to the state
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Than thou the shadow of succession;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: For of no right, nor colour like to right,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: He doth fill fields with harness in the realm,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Turns head against the lion's armed jaws,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And, being no more in debt to years than thou,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Leads ancient lords and reverend bishops on
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To bloody battles and to bruising arms.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: What never-dying honour hath he got
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Against renowned Douglas! whose high deeds,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Whose hot incursions and great name in arms
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Holds from all soldiers chief majority
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And military title capital
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Through all the kingdoms that acknowledge Christ:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Thrice hath this Hotspur, Mars in swathling clothes,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: This infant warrior, in his enterprises
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Discomfited great Douglas, ta'en him once,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Enlarged him and made a friend of him,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To fill the mouth of deep defiance up
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And shake the peace and safety of our throne.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And what say you to this? Percy, Northumberland,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: The Archbishop's grace of York, Douglas, Mortimer,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Capitulate against us and are up.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: But wherefore do I tell these news to thee?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Why, Harry, do I tell thee of my foes,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Which art my near'st and dearest enemy?
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Thou that art like enough, through vassal fear,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Base inclination and the start of spleen
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To fight against me under Percy's pay,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To dog his heels and curtsy at his frowns,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To show how much thou art degenerate.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Do not think so; you shall not find it so:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And God forgive them that so much have sway'd
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Your majesty's good thoughts away from me!
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: I will redeem all this on Percy's head
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And in the closing of some glorious day
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Be bold to tell you that I am your son;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: When I will wear a garment all of blood
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And stain my favours in a bloody mask,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Which, wash'd away, shall scour my shame with it:
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And that shall be the day, whene'er it lights,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: That this same child of honour and renown,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: This gallant Hotspur, this all-praised knight,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And your unthought-of Harry chance to meet.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: For every honour sitting on his helm,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Would they were multitudes, and on my head
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: My shames redoubled! for the time will come,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: That I shall make this northern youth exchange
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: His glorious deeds for my indignities.
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Percy is but my factor, good my lord,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: To engross up glorious deeds on my behalf;
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: And I will call him to so strict account,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: That he shall render every glory up,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Yea, even the slightest worship of his time,
play_title_long: The First Part of Henry the Fourth
scene_title: SCENE II.  London. The palace.

line_text: Or I will tear the reckoning from his heart.
